models.name: Enterprise

fields.name: enterpriseCode
fields.documentation: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the enterprise following corporate naming standards
fields.businessRule: Must be globally unique across all corporate entities and follow established naming convention
fields.dataSource: Corporate IT during enterprise setup or acquisition integration
examples: ACME-AERO - Aerospace division of ACME Corporation
fields.validation: Must be uppercase, alphanumeric with hyphens, 6-20 characters
fields.businessImpact: Primary reference for all corporate reporting, financial consolidation, and regulatory filings

fields.name: enterpriseName
fields.documentation: Official legal name of the enterprise as registered with regulatory authorities
fields.businessRule: Must match legal corporate registration documents exactly
fields.dataSource: Legal department and corporate registration documents
fields.validation: Must match official corporate documents, required for legal compliance
fields.businessImpact: Used in all legal documents, contracts, and regulatory submissions
fields.complianceNotes: Legal entity name required for contracts, regulatory filings, and financial reporting

fields.name: headquarters
fields.documentation: Primary corporate headquarters location for legal and administrative purposes
fields.businessRule: Must reflect official corporate headquarters as filed with regulatory authorities
fields.dataSource: Corporate legal department and SEC filings
fields.businessImpact: Determines tax obligations, regulatory requirements, and legal jurisdiction
fields.complianceNotes: Required for tax jurisdiction determination and regulatory compliance

models.documentation: Top-level organizational entity representing the entire company or corporation with multiple manufacturing sites

models.dataOwner: Corporate IT and Operations Management
models.updateFrequency: Rarely updated, typically during corporate restructuring or acquisitions
models.complianceNotes: Corporate entity information required for regulatory reporting, financial consolidation, and international trade compliance
models.dataRetention: Permanent retention for corporate records and regulatory compliance
models.securityClassification: Internal - Corporate organizational information

examples.explanation: Multi-national aerospace company with facilities across North America and Europe

examples.explanation: Specialized medical device manufacturer with strict FDA compliance requirements

models.name: Site

fields.name: siteCode
fields.documentation: Unique identifier for manufacturing site following corporate site naming standards
fields.businessRule: Must be unique globally across all enterprise sites and follow geographic naming convention
fields.dataSource: Corporate facilities management and site operations
fields.format: LOCATION-NN format where LOCATION is 3-letter city code and NN is sequential number
examples: DFW-02 - Second site in Dallas-Fort Worth area
SEA-03 - Third site in Seattle area
fields.validation: Must follow corporate naming standard, be unique across enterprise
fields.businessImpact: Primary reference for all site-specific operations, scheduling, and reporting

fields.name: siteName
fields.documentation: Descriptive name of the manufacturing facility for operational identification
fields.businessRule: Should clearly identify the site's purpose and location for operational clarity
fields.dataSource: Site operations management and facilities planning
fields.businessImpact: Used in operational communications, shipping documents, and customer communications

fields.name: location
fields.documentation: Physical address or geographic location of the manufacturing site
fields.businessRule: Must be accurate for shipping, logistics, and emergency response coordination
fields.dataSource: Facilities management and logistics planning
fields.format: City, State/Province, Country or full street address
fields.validation: Must be valid geographic location
fields.businessImpact: Critical for logistics, shipping, emergency response, and regulatory compliance

fields.name: enterpriseId
fields.documentation: Foreign key linking site to its parent enterprise organization
fields.businessRule: Must reference valid enterprise, cannot be changed without corporate approval
fields.dataSource: Corporate organizational structure and site ownership records
fields.validation: Must exist in Enterprise table, required for organizational hierarchy
fields.businessImpact: Defines corporate ownership and reporting hierarchy for financial and operational reporting

models.name: MaterialLot

fields.name: lotNumber
fields.documentation: Unique identifier for a specific lot or batch of material with complete traceability
fields.businessRule: Must be globally unique across all lots and follow lot numbering convention for traceability
fields.dataSource: Generated by materials management system upon receipt or internal lot creation
examples: TI-240325-001 - First titanium lot received March 25, 2024
SS-240320-005 - Fifth stainless steel lot received March 20, 2024
PEEK-240315-002 - Second PEEK polymer lot received March 15, 2024
fields.validation: Must be unique globally, follow format standard, cannot be changed once assigned
fields.auditTrail: Critical for product traceability and recall procedures
fields.businessImpact: Primary reference for all material traceability, quality control, and regulatory compliance

fields.name: supplierLotNumber
fields.documentation: Original lot or batch number from the material supplier for upstream traceability
fields.businessRule: Must match supplier certification documents exactly for traceability continuity
fields.dataSource: Supplier documentation, material certificates, and packing lists
examples: SUPP-TI-789456 - Supplier's internal titanium lot number
MED-CERT-456789 - Medical grade material certificate number
fields.validation: Must match supplier documentation, required for certified materials
fields.businessImpact: Enables upstream traceability to supplier source and original certifications

fields.name: expirationDate
fields.documentation: Date when material lot expires or becomes unsuitable for use in production
fields.businessRule: Materials cannot be used after expiration date, system must enforce this restriction
fields.dataSource: Supplier specifications, material certificates, and shelf-life standards
fields.validation: Must be future date at time of receipt, enforced in production planning
fields.businessImpact: Prevents use of expired materials that could compromise product quality or safety
fields.complianceNotes: Critical for aerospace and medical applications where expired materials are prohibited

models.name: MaterialTransaction

fields.name: transactionType
fields.documentation: Type of material movement or inventory transaction being recorded
fields.businessRule: Transaction type determines inventory impact and cost accounting treatment
fields.dataSource: Production control system, inventory management, and shop floor transactions
fields.validation: Must be valid transaction type with proper authorization
fields.auditTrail: All transactions logged for financial and regulatory audit compliance
fields.businessImpact: Determines inventory valuation, cost allocation, and material availability
validValues: RECEIPT - Material received into inventory from supplier
ISSUE - Material issued from inventory to production
RETURN - Unused material returned to inventory from production
TRANSFER - Material moved between locations or lots
ADJUSTMENT - Inventory correction or cycle count adjustment
SCRAP - Material scrapped or written off as waste

fields.name: quantity
fields.documentation: Amount of material involved in the transaction with appropriate units of measure
fields.businessRule: Quantity must be positive for receipts/issues, can be negative for returns/adjustments
fields.dataSource: Physical measurement, scale readings, or count verification
fields.format: Decimal number with unit of measure (lbs, kg, pieces, etc.)
fields.validation: Must be positive for normal transactions, match physical verification
fields.businessImpact: Affects inventory levels, cost calculations, and material availability for production
